org.gearvrf.scene_objects.view

Interface GVRView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GVRFrameLayout, GVRTextView, GVRWebView

    public interface GVRView
    Because it is not possible add a Android view to the GVRScene, GVRView is a special view that provides a way to draw View into some GVRViewSceneObject added to the scene graph. Call GVRActivity.registerView(View) to add the GVRView to Android hierarchy view. After it has been registered, the UI Thread will call draw(Canvas) to refresh the view as necessary. To draw the GVRView into its GVRViewSceneObject is necessary override draw(Canvas) and call the superclass version replacing the given Canvas by other one provided by GVRViewSceneObject.lockCanvas(). After drawing into the GVRViewSceneObject's Canvas, the caller must invoke GVRViewSceneObject.unlockCanvasAndPost(android.graphics.Canvas) to post the new contents to the scene object. 
      
 public void draw(Canvas canvas) {
     if (mSceneObject == null) return;
     Canvas glAttachedCanvas = mSceneObject.lockCanvas();
     super.draw(glAttachedCanvas);
     mSceneObject.unlockCanvasAndPost(glAttachedCanvas);
   }
    Once you are done with a particular instance you need to call GVRActivity.unregisterView(View) on it to avoid memory leaks. See GVRWebView and GVRViewSceneObject

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
      To draw the GVRView into its GVRViewSceneObject is necessary override draw(Canvas) and call the superclass version replacing the given Canvas by other one provided by GVRViewSceneObject.lockCanvas().
      android.view.View getView()
      GVRViewSceneObject will call it to get the view.
      void setSceneObject(GVRViewSceneObject sceneObject)
      The scene object created to this view will call setSceneObject(GVRViewSceneObject) to set itself to the view.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        To draw the GVRView into its GVRViewSceneObject is necessary override draw(Canvas) and call the superclass version replacing the given Canvas by other one provided by GVRViewSceneObject.lockCanvas(). After drawing into the GVRViewSceneObject's Canvas, the caller must invoke GVRViewSceneObject.unlockCanvasAndPost(android.graphics.Canvas) to post the new contents to the scene object. See GVRViewSceneObject.lockCanvas() and GVRViewSceneObject.unlockCanvasAndPost(Canvas)
        Parameters:
        canvas - Use it to get some dimensions to be applied to the new Canvas given by GVRViewSceneObject.lockCanvas()

      • setSceneObject

        void setSceneObject(GVRViewSceneObject sceneObject)
        The scene object created to this view will call setSceneObject(GVRViewSceneObject) to set itself to the view.
        Parameters:
        sceneObject - GVRViewSceneObject created to this view.

      • getView

        android.view.View getView()
        GVRViewSceneObject will call it to get the view.
        Returns:
        Returns GVRView instance as Android view.
